result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Cases called:  15CF38 & 14CF478,  Defendant Scott A Burdick in court with attorney David Karpe.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   In 15CF38, Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count one. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence withheld, 3 yr. probation, conds: 30 days jail, starting Sept. 11, 2015 at 7 p.m. Huber granted under jail rules. Submit DNA sample. $518 costs. Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations.  No jail credit. 14CF478 read in and dismissed.  Traffic matter to be set for trial.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 07-15-2015 02:45 pm

Defendant Scott A Burdick in court with attorney David Karpe.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases called 14CF478 & 15CF38.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over in each case.  Information was filed.  Reading was waived.  Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued.

Cases heard: 14CF478 & 15CF38, Defendant, Scott A Burdick, appeared with Atty. David Karpe. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Reading waived in 15CF38. Time limits waived. $2,000 recog. bond with felony conds.  Return date scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
Discovery letter filed.
Defendant may remain in FL until Feb. 23, 2015 at which point he will return to Wisconsin. Return date continued to March 2, 2015
Defendant may travel to Cape Canaveral FL  on Jan 12, 2015 and return to WI on Jan. 23, 2015
